p: Flavones, namely, isoscutellarein, luteolin, and apigenin glycosides were also representative phenolic constituents of the extract, accounting for 16%, 10% and 3% of the total phenolic content of the extract, respectively. Among these, isoscutellarein- O-glucuronide (T R 27.0 min) was assigned due the UV max at 268 and 337 nm and the m/z 461→285 consistent with the loss of a glucuronyl moiety (−176 u). In a similar way, the fragment ion at m/z 285 and the UV max at 254, 264 and 345 nm, compatible with luteolin, and the main ion [M-H] − at m/z, 461 allowed the identification of luteolin- O-glucuronide (T R 21.3 min, MW 462), eluted in peak 15. Peak 6 with UV max compatible with apigenin (271, 333 nm) showed a molecular ion at m/z 593 and typical C-glycosyl fragments at m/z 473, 503 and 383, allowing the identification of apigenin di- C-glucoside.
